intro: Agrostophyllum emwoodiae, commonly known as the Emwood's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are berry-like and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. The botanical study of this species provides insights into parasitic plant ecology and host-plant interactions.
